@DataPrivacyDay The @FTC often has #IoT-events http://t.co/zr9WwOLIiF and @IEEESA is another good resource http://t.co/35j5xPo7Ey #chatdpd
@DataPrivacyDay [5/5] Finally, how is the thing going to be updated, and how will any software flaws be addressed? #chatdpd
@DataPrivacyDay [4/5] What happens when the thing fails, or when it is unable to reach the internet? #chatdpd
@DataPrivacyDay [3/5] What sensors the thing has and what it does with the data it collects? #chatdpd
@DataPrivacyDay [2/5] What does the thing interact with and the harm this could cause? #chatdpd
@DataPrivacyDay They should ask themselves: Who should be able to configure or use services on thing? #chatdpd [1/5]
@DataPrivacyDay [2/2] and will need to know how to protect their customers. #chatdpd
@DataPrivacyDay IoT will lead to an explosion in collected data. Companies will be responsible for incredibly personal data #chatdpd [1/2]
@MirskyLegal @DataPrivacyDay They aren't. That's why we think TOS and privacy policies need to be visual. #chatdpd
@DataPrivacyDay By being transparent with how they use your data, with whom they might share it, and how you can control it #chatdpd
@DataPrivacyDay Preferences will differ per product. You should always check a company's privacy policies before you use the device #chatdpd
@DataPrivacyDay Blogs are a good place to start. We put our #IoT research there! For example: http://t.co/PYBiWO1ZBk #chatdpd
@JustinBrookman @TRUSTe precisely why security & privacy should be baked into these devices early on :) #chatdpd
@DataPrivacyDay Hopefully it’ll encourage the industry to start building security in from the design stage. #chatdpd
@DataPrivacyDay That's true. Low-hanging fruit is often attractive!
@DataPrivacyDay [2/2] Bad guys will target medical devices, high value devices, & devices that collect sensitive or valuable data #chatdpd
@DataPrivacyDay Bad guys will target whatever is the most valuable. #chatdpd [1/2]
@DataPrivacyDay Making sure that personal info is secured & systems are built such that bad guys can’t jump into critical systems #chatdpd
@DataPrivacyDay [2/2] This far outstrips the PC market and is more than 10 times bigger than the smartphone market. #chatdpd
@DataPrivacyDay The answer is volume. The IOT market is forecast to reach 26 Billion Units by 2020, according to @Gartner_inc #chatdpd [1/2]
@DataPrivacyDay [3/3] Tighter integration of #IoT can help us interact with the digital world w/out changing how we physically act #chatdpd
@DataPrivacyDay [2/3] For example, by discretely monitoring our health connected things can tell us how we are doing. #chatdpd
@DataPrivacyDay There are a number of ways the IoT can benefit our lives. #chatdpd [1/3]
@DataPrivacyDay #IoT is everyday products becoming connected. It means your devices will become smarter, but may become less secure #chatdpd
@DataPrivacyDay Lookout is a mobile security company whose mission is to protect people & devices as they become more connected! #chatdpd
